name: chicagotribune
text: Chicagoans can do their part to help repair damage in their neighborhoods by joining cleanup efforts, making donations, supporting businesses and reporting vandalism to those organizing cleanup efforts. Here's how: https://t.co/uPwMPFYVuq

name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago Public Schools will resume its “grab and go” free meal pickups on Tuesday following a one-day suspension attributed to unrest in the city. https://t.co/ZCrSxfYtgC

text: RT @mandophotos: Protesters making there way to Lake Shore Drive https://t.co/cSsunLCjk5

name: chicagotribune
text: Peaceful protests. Looted storefronts. A wave of arrests. Chicagoans on Monday were left to grapple with the fallout of a chaotic weekend and pick up the pieces. https://t.co/eDNR98dl4Q

name: chicagotribune
text: George Floyd’s death at the hands of police in Minneapolis catalyzed days of protests in Chicago. But activists say the demonstrations here are rooted in anger over decades of abuse of African Americans by the city’s officers.  https://t.co/OUYNbu7g7f

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @dhinkel: Here’s my story giving some context to the complaints of local activists protesting the mistreatment of African-Americans by Chicago police. They’re angry about George Floyd, but also Rekia Boyd, Paul O’Neal and others. https://t.co/LGkhHrhOix

text: RT @srfreish: Protesters are still marching around downtown Naperville. name: chicagotribune
text: Chicago police and city leaders defended the handling of protests and looting amid criticism — including from some aldermen — that officers didn't do enough to quell unrest. https://t.co/159BjHRS6B

text: RT @erinhooley: While photographing inside El Patron liquor in #Cicero, 2 men who were hiding in the back storeroom jumped out in front of me and walked with their hands up to be arrested by police. name: chicagotribune
text:
After Gene & Georgetti restaurant took a hit from looters, its owners said she understands why "there is anger right now."

"We can repair our damage. We know that there’s a much larger discussion that should be happening and needs to be happening." https://t.co/u3fiAS7lO9

name: chicagotribune
text: Appearing on CNN, Gov. Pritzker condemned President Trump's response to nationwide protests, calling him "a miserable failure." https://t.co/1t7tLo1bUe

name: chicagotribune
text: "I am outraged." The bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Washington criticized President Trump for staging a visit to a historic church after authorities cleared the area of peaceful protesters. https://t.co/ayeTkI6YCt
